title: Crispy Baked Cauliflower with Soy Dipping Sauce
directions: Whisk together eggs, Dijon mustard and ½ tsp salt in a medium bowl. Set aside.

Combine panko, sesame seeds, remaining 1½ tsp salt, garlic powder, pepper, ginger, red pepper flakes and turmeric in a medium bowl. Divide panko mixture between two medium bowls. Set one bowl of panko mixture aside.

Working in batches, dip half of cauliflower florets in egg mixture, shaking off excess. Transfer florets to the first bowl of panko mixture and toss to coat. Place on parchment paper-lined baking sheets.
Continue breading with remaining egg mixture, cauliflower and second bowl of panko mixture.
Bake until cauliflower is lightly browned and tender, about 25 to 30 minutes. Serve with Sesame Soy Dipping Sauce.
ingredients: 1 head cauliflower, cut into 1½ inch florets (about 10 cups)

Heat canola oil and sesame oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, ginger and red pepper flakes; sauté until fragrant, about 1 to 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, honey and rice vinegar. Bring to a simmer.
